DataElement.preferredDefinition: The characterization of the type of disease relapse (return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement) experienced. The basis for the relapse decision.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Response Domain Progressive Disease Or Recurrent Disease Post Last Personal Contact Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to tumor response._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The return of a disease after a period of remission._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._Direct or indirect interaction between individuals or organizations._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
